triageFlags.title: Excessive Debt-to-Income Ratio
triageFlags.description: The applicant's DTI ratio significantly exceeds the maximum allowable threshold for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to affordability concerns.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, Tier C applicants must have a DTI ratio of 35% or less. The current DTI ratio of 180.33% indicates that the applicant's financial obligations are unsustainable relative to their income.

triageFlags.title: Maximum Loan-to-Value Ratio Reached
triageFlags.description: The LTV ratio is at the maximum allowable limit for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider the risk of approving a loan at the maximum LTV limit.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 95% for Tier C applicants. While this is within the limit, it represents a high-risk scenario with no buffer for asset depreciation or other financial risks.

content.reasoning: The applicant's DTI ratio of 180.33% far exceeds the maximum allowable threshold of 35% for Tier C, indicating severe affordability concerns. Additionally, the LTV ratio is at the maximum permissible limit, leaving no margin for risk mitigation.
